titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Gordon Browning Memoir, circa 1966 MPA.0208
titlestmt.author: Matthew Brown

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-08-30 10:41:56 -0400.

did.abstract: This collection consists of a typescript draft of Gordon Browning's memoirs.
did.langmaterial: The material in this collection is in English.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Gordon Browning (D) was born in Carroll County, Tennessee in 1895.He graduated from the Cumberland School of Law in 1915. He was a member of the Tennessee National Guard and travelled to Europe during World War I. Browning practiced law after the war.Browning lost an election for United States Congress in 1920. He won the the election of 1922 and served as a member of the United States Congress for six terms. In 1934 he lost a campaign for a two-year term in the United States Senate.He ran for Governor of Tennessee in 1936. He won the election and became governor in 1937. He lost the gubernatorial election of 1938 to Prentice Cooper. Browning was successful in the gubernatorial election of 1948 after defeating Republican candidate Roy Acuff. He was re-elected governor in 1950 after defeating Clifford Allen. Browning lost the campaign for relection in 1952 to Frank G. Clement. Gordon Browning died in 1976.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a typescript draft of Gordon Browning's memoirs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Gordon Browning memoirs, circa 1966, MPA.0206. University of Tennessee Libraries, Knoxville, Special Collections.

otherfindaid.head: Previous Citation
otherfindaid.p: This collection was previously listed as MS.1045

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: This collection was arranged and described by Matthew Brown in February 2012.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Modern Political Archives .

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Modern Political Archives are housed at the Howard H. Baker Center for Public Policy. Researchers interested in consulting the MPA collections are advised to contact the Modern Political Archives .
